Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2012 01:00PM lba1224 wrote: I read the report and it is ALL over the place. Sat down with another radiologist who pointed out my linear calcs and he also recommended bx. Birads 4a. Bx tomorrow and surgical appt next Tuesday. Even if benign, I need someone to be following this. Linear is not good!! I am also wondering if this could have anything to do with weaning my twins about 9 months ago. Probably not...
Posts.Title: Scattered bilateral calcifications lba1224 lba1224

Posts.Content: lba1224 wrote: Recently, I had a baseline mammogram and was called back for diag mammo/ultrasound.  U/S was apparently normal but mammo showed scattered calcifications bilaterally (I have yet to see the report) that were thought to be benign.  But...radiologist recommended bx of ONE calcification.  If benign, then we will know all are benign.  I feel so uncomfortable with this plan.  Even if all the calcs look similar, it seems like an inaccurate way to gauge the character of the other calcs.  If the radiologist had just asked me to return in 6 months for U/S, I would not have been worried.  BTW, no family hx.  Thinking of seeing a BS.  Does this seem like overkill?? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scattered bilateral calcifications lba1224 lba1224

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2012 12:49PM lba1224 wrote: Thx! I guess I was worried that the radiologist wanted to biopsy even though everything was benign in appearance. No groups, clusters, etc. Strange. I will have to get the report tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Scattered bilateral calcifications lba1224 lba1224

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2012 11:42PM lba1224 wrote: Yes, I totally agree with you. Funny thing is, she gave me a choice of F/U in 6 months or biopsy (and strongly encouraged bx) so did I determine my own BiRads score??? Scary.

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2012 09:10AM lba1224 wrote: So I went in to discuss results with a different radiologist. Turns out, I have linear calcs concerning for DCIS!! Can't believe I wasn't told this before. So off to biopsy...
